html: 7.2.19  9:16 pm   are you actually quitting YouTube?

7.2.19  9:07 pm   do you play guitar?

      and if you do when did you start? (i feel like i started really late)

7.2.19  9:06 pm   Oh boy. I watched a video about chords the other day, and it was really interesting. The video made me realise that I should definitely learn more about music stuff, so I decided to download a free demo version of some random music theory book today. The book thing introduced me to basic music notation stuff first. I was doing fine and having fun until I came across tuplets/grouplets. I just straight up had a short crying session because the darn thing blew my mind (in a negative way). Like, how are you supposed to divide a whole note into three half notes???

      A whole note is worth 4 beats, and a half note is worth 2 beats. 3 times 2 equals 6, not 4!! I'm so confused?!?!

      I just wanted to have fun!! I've even watched some videos regarding this topic, but I'm still not quite sure if I get the hang of it. I did try to make my own definition, but I think I might need your help with improving it. It basically goes like this: "a tuplet/grouplet is a group o f multip le shorter notes used as a substitute for a single longer note (for example a group of 3 eighth notes can be used instead of a single quarter note)" . Does my definition make any sense? How would you explain tuplets in your own words? What's the most important thing to know about tuplets? Also, where can I find really good examples of tuplets in songs? Thank you a lot in advance!!!

thisthisthisthis

7.2.19  7:56 pm   i have been searching for awhile and getting more and more upset at the lack of clarity of information.  would you mind going into some detail about what you know of compulsory licensing for doing covers.  as well as the idea of a 'derivative work' rather than a 'cover' and how that requires songwriter permission rather than a compulsory license.  i can't even figure out how to go about getting compulsory licenses or how much they would cost.  and i know that many people just don't even worry about it and post things without licenses but it makes me sort of scared to do that.  i really just don't want to bother with this crap because it sounds like a horrendous messy use of brainpower and time.  fuck word-soup-lawyer-speak.  so frustrating.

7.2.19  6:26 pm   when you first started out making your own music was it simpler than what you're doing now? i started writing my own songs after years of just covering stuff and even though i can play really complicated songs by other people my own songs are very simple. a few basic chords, simple melodies, not much crazy going on. is this normal or do i just suck? and i want to note that i do not equate complexity with quality, but i guess i'd like to eventually do songs in crazy time signatures with weird progressions and other funky things.

7.1.19  8:19 pm   had a question about the song might quit; the solo plays the main melody in three octaves:

Highest oct: Dadada da da daaa
Middle oct: Dododo do do dooo
Lower oct: Dududu du du du du du duuu dudu duu...

I always enjoy listening to that song, but I can't help but notice how the middle oct melody (second dadada) doesn't quite fall in the right beat, not quite in sync. did you notice that or did that on purpose?

7.1.19  6:57 pm   If you're still on logic 9 I'd HIGHLY suggest that you make the jump to X.

      The transition isn't nearly as bad as moving to FCPX,

      but it's just better. The developers really listen to feedback and keep adding new features, some of which others would charge full price for.

      I think it's worth looking into, while you're in this phase of upheaval.
7.1.19  5:52 pm   why arent you making songs anymore?

7.1.19  5:41 pm   I believe creativity is partly about finding new connections between existing things, and having the right skillset to have people effectively feel that connection when experiencing your creation, would you agree?

      I couldn't help but think of your core desire of thinking of something and have it appear in someones mind as an example of the creative endeavour, and the better your skillset is, the better and clearer it may appear in audience's mind. I just don't know if im oversimplifying what creativity is, which is why i say "is partly about " as opposed to "is all about"
